details.description: You must register to run a nursing agency in Wales - learn how to apply, conditions, fines and penalties
details.licence_short_description: Registration needed to run a nursing agency in Wales
details.licence_overview:
$! To run a nursing agency in Wales you must register it, meet certain standards and operate according to the current regulations. $!

The minimum standards and the regulations make sure the agency is managed properly and provides quality care.

$D [Download 'Nursing agencies: minimum standards' document (PDF, 105KB)](http://wales.gov.uk/subsites/caresocialservicesinspect/publications/nmsnursingagencies/nmsnursese.pdf?lang=en "Download 'Nursing agencies: minimum standards' (PDF, 105KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

For information on the other legal conditions you must meet, such as quality of service and premises and record-keeping, see ['Regulations for nurses' agencies'](http://wales.gov.uk/cssiwsubsite/newcssiw/aboutus/providingsocialcare/nursesagencies/nurseregs/?lang=en "Regulations for nurses agencies'"){:rel="external"} on the Care and Social Services Inspectorate Wales (CSSIW) website. 

You must also read [The Nurses Agencies (Wales) Regulations 2003.](http://www.legislation.gov.uk/wsi/2003/2527/contents/made "The Nurses Agencies (Wales) Regulations 2003"){:rel="external"}

## Restrictions

If you want to operate or manage more than one agency you must make a separate application for each one.

## How to register

You must contact your local CSSIW office to register. [Find your local office](http://wales.gov.uk/cssiwsubsite/newcssiw/aboutus/providingsocialcare/registration/?lang=en "How to register"){:re="external"} on their webiste. 

You must pay an annual fee of Â£500.

## Fines and penalties

If you don't register, don't meet the minimum standards or break the regulations, you could be taken to court.
